Description: Rim and neck sherd of perhaps North Ionian pottery krater; white slip; interior glazed black; maeander pattern on top of rim; frieze of single dots around edge of rim; exterior, on neck, elaborate floral pattern between narrow black bands; below, row of short strokes at top of shoulder.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 43, no. 157 pl. 38)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 248, no. 8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.091)
